lexUnit.name: impede.v

corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

lexUnit.definition: COD: delay or block the progress or action of.

sentence.text: Unrelated participles do not usually seriously impede a reader 's understanding , but they are generally considered incorrect forms .
Since wage pressure is the main factor impeding the reduction of unemployment much work has been done on the factors affecting this .
This results in ` inappropriate sociocultural patterns " which impede independent development .
However , as the very existence of the catholic -- nationalist alliance impedes progress towards such a solution , one should perhaps view such a possibility as unreal .
Holding the candle before him , Luther led the boy to the far end of the landing , his awkward movements impeding his progress .
The bollards at each end have been successful in keeping out vehicles , without impeding the passage of bicycles , prams etc .

This high level is a primary risk in heart disease , since excess cholesterol builds up a sticky silt-like deposit in the arteries , impeding the passage of blood and increasing the pressure on the heart .
` If any were against the proposal , either they were too lily-livered to protest -- or else they were impeded by the rush for the exits ! "
Exports to the USA had , however , been impeded during the late 1980s by US obstacles , placed in retaliation against ` unfair practices " .
Democratic changes are slow and impeded by agreements forged with the former military government .
Clearly , this is a programme which could command considerable support , but its development has been impeded by several problems .
Cobden 's hero was the trader , who had no use for protective tariffs which impeded the expansion of commerce between nations .
Likewise , aesthetically lacquered trappings dramatically impede the movements of the drama 's main characters .
These bearing-plinths are often damaged , impeding the working of the bearings and putting stress on the road deck .
How could she notice such a trivial detail when her vision was impeded by tears ?
The flow of water in and out of the Pool is so greatly impeded that evaporation under the grilling sun has made the waters very salty indeed .

But these overall success rates are much higher than the pass rates at individual examination sessions , because many candidates ' progress through the examinations is impeded because they have to resit .
They understood that neutralism and non-alignment could impede or restrain the development of close military relations between many newly independent states and the Western powers .
Goram 's prodigious clearance sent McCoist racing into the Belgians ' box , where he looked to be impeded .
If the police come to interview Frau Morenz , do not impede but let me know .
This is particularly important for the newly toilet-trained who might have a mishap if they are impeded !

In November 1997 , Russia ratified the CWC , but financial and other difficulties have impeded the destruction of its chemical weapons stockpile , so it is far behind the timetable specified in the treaty .
